page.title: 05Local History
page.content: The{Weavers Cottage}in{Kilbarchan}is a fine example of an eighteenth century weavers house.It was built in{1723}and occupies a prominent position at {Kilbarchan Cross.}Throughout the centuries the fabric of the building deteriorated and by{1947}the cottage was due to be demolished.{Willie {Meikle,Lord Dundee and Mrs Halifax } {Crawford}were all instrumental in securing the permanent preservation of the building.In{1952}the cottage was gifted to the{National Trust}and efforts made to arouse local interest and gain financial support.In{1954} restoration work began and much of the original structure saved.In{Sept 1957} the cottage was opened by{Lord Wemyss. The cottage is furnished and shows what life in{Kilbarchan}was like many years ago.
